section.heading: Assault with intent to commit mayhem or with dangerous weapon.
section.text: Every person convicted of an assault with intent to commit mayhem, or of an assault with a dangerous weapon, shall be sentenced to imprisonment for not more than 10 years. In addition to any other penalty provided under this section, a person may be fined an amount not more than the amount set forth in § 22-3571.01.

annoGroup.heading: Cross References
annoGroup.annotation: Additional penalty for possession of firearm, see § 22-4502.

annoGroup.heading: Section References
annoGroup.annotation: This section is referenced in § 5-132.21, § 7-2508.01, and § 24-112.

annoGroup.heading: Effect of Amendments
annoGroup.annotation: The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-317 added the last sentence.

annoGroup.heading: Emergency Legislation
annoGroup.annotation: For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 303(e) of the Criminal Fine Proportionality Emergency Act of 2013 (D.C. Act 20-45, April 1, 2013, 60 DCR 5400, 20 DCSTAT 1300).

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.annotation: Applicability of D.C. Law 19-317: Section 401 of D.C. Law 19-317 provided that the act shall apply only to offenses committed on or after June 11, 2013.
